meanings.definition: Relating to or involving measurement of time.
meanings.sent1: The chronometric study of the sun's movement helped ancient civilizations track time.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used a chronometric method to measure the duration of the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The chronometric clock had a special feature that made time fly by faster when you were having fun.
meanings.sent4: Her chronometric memory was like a precise stopwatch, never missing a beat.
meanings.sent5: The chronometric scale on the ruler made it easy to measure time intervals accurately.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a chronometer or chronograph.
meanings.sent1: The chronometric device on the ship helped sailors navigate the seas accurately.
meanings.sent2: The watchmaker specialized in crafting intricate chronometric timepieces.
meanings.sent3: The chronometric stopwatch at the race had a quirky habit of starting on its own.
meanings.sent4: His heart beat in a chronometric rhythm, steady and unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The chronometric precision of the clock was unmatched, never losing a second.
